meanings.definition: A line that divides something into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The centerlines on the cake helped us cut it into equal halves.
meanings.sent2: The centerlines on the ruler show the middle point.
meanings.sent3: The magician used the centerlines to magically split the scarf into two pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the centerlines of a perfect symmetry in the photograph.
meanings.sent5: The centerlines on the map guided us through the maze of streets.

meanings.definition: A line that runs through the center of something.
meanings.sent1: The centerlines on the basketball court mark the middle.
meanings.sent2: The centerlines on the paper show where to fold it.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked along the centerlines of the carpet as if it was a runway.
meanings.sent4: His words cut through her heart like sharp centerlines.
meanings.sent5: The centerlines on the tree trunk indicated its age and growth.

meanings.definition: A line that marks the center of a road.
meanings.sent1: The driver stayed between the centerlines while driving.
meanings.sent2: The centerlines on the highway help in traffic management.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel balanced on the centerlines of the road, looking both ways.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed through her like a melody following the centerlines of a road.
meanings.sent5: The centerlines on the street were freshly painted for safety.
